content.question: The derivative of a function <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is given by <math alttext="f prime of x, equals, 0.2 x, plus e raised to the 0.15 x power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>â€²</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0.2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0.15</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following procedures can be used to determine the value of <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> at which the line tangent to the graph of <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> has slope 2 ?

choices.label: Evaluate <math alttext="0.2 x, plus e raised to the 0.15 x power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0.15</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> at <math alttext="x equals 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Evaluate <math alttext="the derivative, with respect to x, open parenthesis, 0.2 x, plus e raised to the 0.15 x power, close parenthesis " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0.15</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> at <math alttext="x equals 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Solve <math alttext="0.2 x, plus e raised to the 0.15 x power, equals 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0.15</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Solve <math alttext="the derivative, with respect to x, open parenthesis, 0.2 x, plus e raised to the 0.15 x power, close parenthesis, equals 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0.15</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: Solve <math alttext="0.2 x, plus e raised to the 0.15 x power, equals 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0.15</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

topic.text: 2.2: Defining the Derivative of a Function and Using Derivative Notation

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
